meanings.definition: To make (someone) familiar with or accustomed to something.
meanings.sent1: She is familiarising her new puppy with the house by showing him around.
meanings.sent2: I am familiarising myself with the new computer software at work.
meanings.sent3: The cat is familiarising itself with the idea of wearing a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The students are familiarising themselves with the concept of gravity through experiments.
meanings.sent5: He is familiarising his taste buds with the spicy cuisine of Thailand.

meanings.sent1: After a few days, she was familiarising herself with the layout of the city.
meanings.sent2: The children are familiarising themselves with the rules of the game.
meanings.sent3: The robot is familiarising itself with human emotions in a humorous way.
meanings.sent4: The detective is familiarising himself with the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent5: The explorer is familiarising himself with the treacherous terrain of the jungle.
